title: The Wall Street Journal
text:
Twitter Shares Slide as Revenue Growth Slows Sharply Twitter added more users in the latest quarter but said its pace of revenue growth slowed sharply because of glitches that hurt its advertising business. Shares fall nearly 20% in early trading. Heard on the Street: A Case of Ad Anxiety

Home-Improvement Boom Is Forecast to Fizzle Home-improvement retailers have proven a bright spot during an otherwise underwhelming stretch for retail stocks, but a popular predictor of remodeling spending suggests tougher times ahead.
description: Breaking news and analysis from the U.S. and around the world at WSJ.com. Politics, Economics, Markets, Life & Arts, and in-depth reporting.
